reviews.text: We stayed at the Royal Grove in Oct 2004, during a budget vacation to Hawaii. The hotel and it's rooms are exactly what they look like on the website - very simple and a bit dated. If you are aware of this going in, you won't have any surprises. The location is amazing, though, and we hardly spent any time in the room. You can walk to the beach, shopping and restaurants. Spend a few extra bucks and get a room with AC - it helps drown out the outside noises. Buy some groceries and take advantage of the in-room fridge to help cut food costs. My only complaint is the doors in the room have large air vents, so you hear everything from the hallways and sometimes from other rooms. This can effect sleeping and romance.
reviews.title: Great bargain

reviews.text: This hotel was worth the money! All we did was sleep here. There is so much to do in oahu! This hotel was 2 blocks away from waikiki beach and 2 blocks from the international marketplace. It's definitely a budget hotel and you get what you paid for. The staff was very helpful and friendly. There are safe boxes behind the counter and that was where we kept our cash. They still use keys and not key cards! The only cons were (1) the queen bed we had was actually 2 twin beds pushed together and (2) there are metal slats in the bottom of the door which don't give you too much privacy. If you go to their website and see the panoramic view of the room you will see what i am talking about. If you can live with those things, like we did it's worth the stay. The room was clean, bug free and we got maid service 2X a week. We definitely had more money to spend on things that were more important like souveniers and our excursions. Enjoy your stay!
reviews.title: Great budget place to stay in waikiki!
Family setting, very hospitable!!
reviews.text: This place is located just a block and a half away from Waikiki beach and priced at an unbelievably low rate. The rooms were decent, but the people who worked there were awesome. They were so helpful and went out of their way when asked any questions. They made our stay there incredible and we will definitely be returning. This place is what Customer service is all about. You can't go wrong staying here!! AAAAA++++++

This hotel is about 2 minutes walking distance to the famous Waikiki Beach so we can go to the beach several times a day. It is also near the International Marketplace so we can go shopping anytime we have extra time. A lot of eating places, shopping and beach strolling so what more can you ask? The hotel has spacious rooms with kitchen though quite old. Good enough for a place to rest your tired body plus it's quite inexpensive. The staff is very helpful and friendly. Would definitely return here when we're in Honolulu.
reviews.title: Hotel with very good location
Great Place
reviews.text: I spent 6 days at the Royal Grove Hotel and I would recommend this place to anyone visiting. The hotel is 2-3 blocks from the beach, retail stores, and near every bus route. The staff was nice, except to people that gave them attitude. My room was clean, bug free, and everything worked. I had heard horror stories about roach motels in Honolulu and the Royal Grove is NOT one of them. Where else are you going to find a place with a balcony and kitchenette for 60 bucks a night. If you are the type of vacationer that just wants to relax in your room or the type that is barely in your room, you won't find a better deal. If you need a jacuzzi, spa, room service, and lots of bells and whistles, better try somewhere else. Hell this place still uses actual room keys and not access cards.
A warming to anyone looking for a non smoking room - I was given a room without a lanai (even though I'd booked a category 1 room with a balcony) because I asked for a non smoking room.
reviews.title: If you want a lanai (balcony), don't ask for a non smoking room

reviews.text: I booked a room with A/C and lanai, but was given a room on the ground floor w/out a lanai. When I queried this, I was told that I had asked for a non-smoking room, and the only non-smoking rooms were on the ground floor with no lanai. When I asked to move to a room with lanai I was told I'd need to wait until the following morning as the night reception staff member couldn't change my room.
reviews.title: Noisy and overrated
this is where you'll find aloha in great abundance
reviews.text: The up side to this room was that it was right next to the pool, facing inside rather than out on to the road, so while there was some noise from the pool during the day it was quiet at night. As a result I decided not to go to the hassle of changing rooms, and so had peaceful nights - but I did miss having a lanai!

I stayed at this hotel for 2 weeks last year, having chosen it on the basis of the reviews I saw on Trip Advisor and I must say I was very disappointed. We were given a very noisy second floor room facing the street and I found it hard to sleep as a result. The room was very large, but rather shabby and dated. The worst part was the parking situation really as it was hit and miss every day as to whether there would be space in the lot across the street. When there wasn't we had to go to another lot about a 10 minute walk away (through an area which becomes pretty seedy late at night). All in all I'd pay a bit more next time for something a little bit more convenient and sophisticated. Unless you're looking for a basic post-beach crash-pad I would avoid.
reviews.title: Great Budget Hotel

reviews.text: Date(s) of stay: Nov 2005
reviews.title: Charming, Kitschy, Old Hawaii. Loved it!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from 2.5 weeks at this charming hotel. Room 604 had a balcony and every morning we had cofee out there and looked down the street to Waikiki beach and all the folks walking down the road with the surfboards on their heads.
reviews.title: Wonderful Royal Grove stay

reviews.text: This room had a kitchenette,which allowed us to make our own breakfasts each morning,a big saving. We chose to eat lunch and supper out,but you could save even more if you ate in.
reviews.title: A Real Bargain

reviews.text: The pool and lobby are warm and inviting,with many interesting guests to meet.People congregated here,for the internet access. Monday nights are the social nights with a group playing music and learning to dance and hula-what a blast!
reviews.title: Great Budget Hotel
Couldn't agree with you more "Taste of the Tiki"
reviews.text: The laundromat on site was a huge bonus,as it was so convenient!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The front desk staff are always friendly and accomodating,always ready to answer our questions and give us directions.The safety deposit boxes(for free) are a super deal!
reviews.title: The Taste of the Tiki Era

reviews.text: We stayed at the Royal Grove Hotel from 6/13/06 thrugh 6/18/06 and loved it. This hotel is the best deal in Oahu. Your two short blocks to the beach and right in the middle of waikiki. The hotel is a bit dated but clean and very quaint. The pool is small but clean. The rooms were big with a kitchenette. If you care about all the small amenities that the big hotels give you with a bigger price, this place is not for you. If your like me and are looking for a clean place with great location and great price, this place is absolutely perfect.
reviews.title: Can't Be Beat

reviews.text: My boyfriend and I recently vacationed in Oahu. We stayed for a week at the Royal Grove hotel and loved it. The hotel is quite cute - vintage Hawaiian. They are in the perfect location - VERY close to Waikiki beach (less then a 5 minute walk), and all the shopping and resturants. The hotel staff was a joy - very friendly and extremely helpful, We stayed on the 5th floor. We had a cute lanai and there was even a fridge out there to store drinks and food so we did not have to go back in the room to get stuff from the kitchen. The place was super clean and well kept. There is a pool on site and internet access. There is also the most yummy Korean BBQ place right next door. One of the best deals for good food in Oahu. I highly recommend it. My boyfriend and I would definately stay at the Royal Grove again.
reviews.title: One Word: Fabulous!

reviews.text: My son and I stayed at the Royal Grove in 2005, we already have our reservations for our next trip in 2007!
reviews.title: Can't Ignore the BIG $$$$ you save
A great deal
reviews.text: The Grove is very dated, but we found it to be clean and the staff to be extremely helpful and respectful. We always had plenty of hot water with good pressure (which I hear can be a problem with budget hotels sometimes). The use of a safety deposit box is free.
You can park across the street for a nominal fee.
reviews.title: Good for transitioning to the island

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is an excellent value -- it is literally a five minute walk to the beach! The rooms are cute and very functional. There is a kitchenette with dining supplies and a fridge, which is perfect for storing leftovers and fruit. The lobby staff were very helpful, and the pool was clean and refreshing. There were also many things you could borrow, like beach supplies and board games. We will definitely stay here again when we return to Waikiki.
reviews.title: Everything you could need for a great price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an older budget property in an excellent location. We stayed on the fifth floor in a reasonably decent room with a view to the beach. The AC was weak, but functional. The decor was dated and worn. But for this price - it was worth it! The staff is friendly and helpful. The atmosphere is more "old Hawaiian." The beach, shops, and restaurants are in easy walking distance. The kitchenette saved us money on eating expenses.
reviews.title: Well run older hotel

reviews.text: I was in Hawaii in Sept., I always stay at the SHERATON PRINCESS KAIULANI HOTEL WHEN I AM IN WAIKIKI THEY WHERE BOOK, UNLESS I WANTED TO PAY $300.00 a night for my self. I book another hotel, I was NOT happy with it, there was a convention in town, not many hotels. I when by the Grove twice, I finally got a room there for 2 weeks and loved it. It is a charming hotel with a lovely staff. The hotel is old but CLEAN AND CHARMING. LOOKING FORWARD TO MY STAY AGAIN NEXT YR.
reviews.title: From PRINCESS KAIULANI TO THE ROYAL GROVE HOTEL..

reviews.text: I booked a month for next year in SEPT. looking forward to seeing new friends I made while I was there.. I CALL THIS PLACE MY PINK PALACE, LOVE IT...
reviews.title: Parsimony to the extreme
Love the Royal Grove!
reviews.text: Hotel is a budget property in a high price area, and guests understand that.

The Royal Grove Hotel lived up to its expectations. We arrived there August 2-6th and although the old fashioned atmosphere took my children aback at first, they soon grew to love it. We were two blocks from the Hyatt, a block from an ABC store and a block and a half from The Bus transportation. The people at the desk were very friendly and let us borrow beach mats and towels for our day trip at Hanauma Bay. The maids were great -- the room was always made up nicely and the towels were clean.
reviews.title: Great Hotel. Great Location.
There's no place like home-(The Royal Grove)
reviews.text: Again, the location and the price makes the Royal Grove a super catch. We could easily walk to Waikiki Beach as well to the other hotels where we caught the Society of Seven and the Magic of Polynesia show. We could also walk to two supermarkets as well as the International Marketplace (hint- the best and cheapest place for souvenirs though is the Aloha Stadium flea market which is opened Wednesday and weekends. The prices were cheaper than all of Oahu and the other three major islands!).
Anyway, you just have to stay at the Royal Grove. Aloha.
reviews.title: Great Trip

reviews.text: Okay, my husband and I and our two children did a survey after arriving home from our 9 day stay at the Royal Grove Hotel in Waikiki just this last week and we decided that if we were to go back tomorrow and had any pick of hotels to stay at, that we would undoubtedly go back to the Royal Grove....it was unanimous! We are an upper middle-class family and could easily afford a more upscale hotel but we truly liked the casual atmosphere there at the Royal Grove.....like "no worries" kind of atmosphere. You just stroll in and you can wear exactly what you feel like there (no need to dress up). The room was basic and you definitely have to overlook certain things because fancy it ain't.... :) but our room was fully equipped with everything we needed...we had a stove, full-sized fridge, kitchen sink and it was fully stocked with dish rack, silverware, fry-pan, bowls, mugs, glasses, spatula, and dishtowels, etc., etc. We had our own balcony and you could allmost throw a pebble up to the waterfront. The Hyatt is across the road and up about 50 yds or so and I can guarantee you that those people are paying a heck of alot more than we did and for what? Our room was very clean and the maids did a great job of cleaning up all the sand we dragged in everyday and everyone there just smiles at you and they are all just super friendly. They have lots of things for you to use, such as sand toys for the little ones, boogie boards, they did have a few snorkel equipment also and this is all on an "honor system". They have a dining table downstairs and a small pool to use, however I cannot imagine why you would come to Waikiki to use a pool for heaven's sake. Emelio, the cockateil is there in the reception area to great you, however he does go to bed quite early so you need to visit with him early in the day. The foyer area is filled with all kinds of traditional hawaiian memorabilia and surfboards on the walls and a couple around the lounge area...(would you see this at the Hyatt???? I think not!) That's what's so cook about this place.....it's uniqueness! You just feel relaxed the moment you walk in. You can do your wash there cheaper than any laundramat anywhere I've ever known. and they have a safe for you to keep any valuables in if you like. All in all, it was just the most relaxing place we've ever stayed in.......ever!
reviews.title: Great For The Budget Minded

reviews.text: we stayed here for 4 nights in totoal. we didnt have a booking but they had places available. its in the heart of wakiki, very close to the beach and to the bus stops. we had a room which has your own bathroom and kitchen. downstairs is free wifi and a pool. if there is 2ppl its works out to be the same price as 2 beds in a dorm room, $65 incl tax. some rooms you can hear the loud traffic of the main street, but get yourself some earplugs and sleeping pills from the chemist and you'll be fine. or if your a heavy sleeper, it won't worry you. if you book in advance try to get a room which is away from the main street. i had a great time staying here. you can catch a cab to the airport for $35 or get a shuttle for $11pp. great staff, clean rooms, what more do u need?
reviews.title: great place to stopover to north shore

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at he Royal Grove Hotel in Waikiki in late October 2012. Our decision was based on the many glowing reviews on TripAdvisor & elsewhere, and we were not disappointed.
reviews.title: Super location, friendly staff & great value for money!

reviews.text: From our first contact by email, the staff were very friendly & welcoming, and they remained so throughout our stay. I made a mistake in my booking (had the dates wrong, having forgotten about the International Date Line), but they were able to give us a room for the first night, and then moved us to another one the next day.
reviews.title: Avoid room 422

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The accommodation as stated in other reviews was a bit "retro", but comfortable & well-equipped for a self-catering room. The pool was a nice treat, and the wifi access in the lobby & breezeway was very handy. The location was only a short walk to the beach & all the popular Waikiki spots.
reviews.title: Excellent Value !

reviews.text: From the moment we checked in, we could tell that many "regulars" stayed there & had been doing so for some time. That's always a sign of a good place.
reviews.title: Superb Value!
Great budget hotel in a convenient location
reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay at the Royal Grove so much we booked it again upon checking out. The hotel is in a very convenient location just 2 blocks from the beach. If that's too far for you, there's also a small pool. There are convenience stores located right next to the hotel and just across the street. The rooms are clean, though the furniture isn't very modern, but that's what makes to hotel so nice. It's not up to date, but has a lot of flair you don't find too often any more. The staff is very friendly, a broken fridge in our room was replaced the same day. We'll stay there again, if we come back to Waikiki!

If you are looking for a resort, this is not it. But if you are looking for a comfortable place that is close to the beach because you just want to go surfing and listen to music then this is a great. It is like old Hawaii. I almost don't want it to become too popular because then it might change. I really enjoyed my time here. If you stay, try not to get a room facing the street.
reviews.title: Very good value.

reviews.text: We just got back from another stay at the Royal Grove..Stayed in room #421 and it was huge. It's like a apartment-1 twin,1 double in a room and a king in another room, full kitchen,big bathroom and a living room and a dining area. Will always ask for that room when we return. No AC but pleanty of fans and windows-we really weren't in the room that long so it was all good. What can I say-Monday night they had live music down by the pool with guests setting in-2 hula dancers, it was better than going to a luau -they really make you feel like Ohana. They people that work there are friendly and very helpful.You are close to the bus,stores for snacks,and best of all about 2 blocks from the Duke statue..The price is very good so if your going there make sure you stay here,you won't be disappointed! Mahalo Royal Grove for a wonderful stay........The Reid Family
reviews.title: Another Great Stay!!!!!!!!

reviews.text: This was our second stay (the first one was 5 years ago). The hotel looks more or less same. It is a walking distance to the famous beach. The rooms are spacious with mini kitchenette and a fridge. We stayed from Sept 20 to 27th. The staff are friendly. There is a wifi on the main floor.
reviews.title: Good value and convenience in Waikiki

reviews.text: We were allowed a late check-out at no charge as our room was booked to be rented that day. it was helpful as our flight was around 11pm.
reviews.title: Warm and welcoming!

reviews.text: We stayed here as a family of 4 for 3 nights. It was in a fantastic location. We could walk to Waikiki, as it was 1.5 blocks away. Therefore we got to experience the nightlife of Honolulu. It was also a fantastic price, considering what other hotels in the area charge.
reviews.title: Ok for the money
